name: GDPR Rights and Lawful Bases
description: Reasoning about data subject rights, erasure exceptions, and lawful bases

theory.natural_language: Under GDPR, data subjects have the right to erasure unless retention is required by legal obligation. Payroll data must be retained for statutory purposes. Marketing consent provides a lawful basis for processing emails. Consent can be withdrawn. If consent is withdrawn, marketing processing must stop. Pseudonymized analytics are allowed for legitimate interest.

queries.natural_language: May an employee demand deletion of their payroll records?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. Payroll data is retained under legal obligation and is exempt from the right to erasure.
expected_answer.explanation: payroll_data RETENTION_REQUIRED legal_obligation overrides RIGHT erasure

queries.natural_language: If a user withdraws consent, should we stop sending marketing emails?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Marketing emails rely on consent, and processing must stop once consent is withdrawn.
expected_answer.explanation: marketing_email LAWFUL_BASIS consent ∧ consent withdrawn ⇒ processing_on_withdrawn_consent PROHIBITED true

queries.natural_language: Can we keep using pseudonymized analytics without asking for consent?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Pseudonymized analytics are covered by legitimate interest in this policy.
